citation.article-title: Exiguobacterium mexicanum sp. nov. and Exiguobacterium artemiae sp. nov., isolated from the brine shrimp Artemia franciscana.

p.s: Description of Exiguobacterium artemiae sp. nov.
Exiguobacterium artemiae ar. te’mi.ae M.L. fem.n.of Artemiae, of/from Artemia, the taxonomic genus name of the brine shrimp
Colonies grown in marine agar 2216 (Difco) are 2–3 mm in diameter after 2 days at 28 °C, yellow-orange, convex with entire margin and glossy.
Gram-positive, non-spore-forming rods, varying in shape and size of rods from 0.6–0.8 μm in diameter×0.9–3.0 μm in length, motile.
Growth occurs under aerobic and anaerobic conditions in both CASO and marine medium.
Growth occurs at 20 and 41 °C but not at 45 °C.

Catalase and oxidase-positive, utilized α-cyclodextrin, β-cyclodextrin, d-gluconic acid, salicine d-sorbitol, turanose, melibiose, d-lactic acid, and d-alanine, other physiological properties are listed in Table 3 and Table 4.
The principal isoprenoid quinones are MK-7, MK-8, and MK-6.
Major fatty acids (>5%) are iC13:0, aiC13:0, iC15:0, C16:0, iC17:0, and C18:0; additionally, minor components are listed in Table 2.
Isolated from a commercial can of A. franciscana cyst.
